description: Restored 1980 Jeep CJ7 Renegade. VIN J0D93EH701527. Odometer reads 103,715. 304ci V8 engine, 904 automatic transmission. Four Wheel Drive. Power steering, power disc brakes, tilt steering, tachometer, hardtop. Runs and drives great. Stops and steers very good. 4x4 works properly. Solid body with good driver quality paint. Solid underneath. Nice interior with no rips or tears. Shows well. New BF Goodrich 31x10.50 tires on new 15x8 chrome wheels. A good, solid Jeep that performs as it should and looks great.
** Please call us at 940-632-9454 to discuss the vehicle. **

1979 Jeep CJ7 Renegade with a fresh restoration. This is not just a paint job, it was full tub off restoration with a compete rebuild of the engine and transmission. It has a upgraded Mallory ignition, Edelbrock manifold and carburetor with electronic choke for a easy start up. Headers, Power steering, Front DISC brakes, Aftermarket cooling fans behind the radiator, this Jeep not only looks the part it drives out and performs as good as it looks. Repainted in it's original factory color of Morocco Buff with the correct Renegade stickers. Fresh BFG All Terrian tires mounted on Eagle Alloys. New soft top with full doors - No Hard Top. Pictured with soft top on and off. The interior has all new upholstery and carpet and you have to love the tilt wheel. This Jeep is stunning and will turn heads any where you go. Contact Shep at 208.721.1973
1977 CJ7. 30,000original miles. Mint condition. 1 owner. 3-speed, V-8. wired to tow w/bar. 25-gallon gas tank. Inside factory orignal. Contact for more photos/information.

1978 Jeep CJ7 RENEGADE LEVI'S EDITION,

Garage Find Stunner! This car has been preserved in time!  Very rare CJ 7 Renegade with many options:  Glove Box Quadratec BW1339, automatic transmission TH 400, steel doors, fiberglass top and top of the line 304 CU V8!  4 x 4 comes with spare tire included and has even original Levi's rivets on the seats!  Details!  Details! Look at the Details! Bought from lady that was the original owner that adored this car.  Documented restoration with receipts of over $6,000 mostly interior and body.  Car has not started in over 9 years.  Perfect car for the true classic collector that is looking to complete an original CJ7 of their dreams. CJ 7 will be sold including customized high end cover, owner's manual, brand new owners workshop manual and more!!
Rare Levi's Edition with 304 V8 Automatic.  33,000 documented miles.  Hard and soft tops.  Rust free time capsule.

Jeep 1978 CJ-7 Renegade, complete frame-off and mechanical restoration, original rebuilt 304 V8, original rebuilt turbo 400 automatic, original rebuilt Autotrac w/PTO, locking front hubs, ps, pb, factory air and fiberglass body, new suspension, new gas tank, spare parts, asking $16,500 or reasonable offer. 919-971-1523, NC; [email]
I've done my research.
Getting this Jeep into the USA is not a problem
This vehicle is
exempt from duty

due to age and where it was originally manufactured (Toledo, OH).  There is no duty on the vehicle because the VIN has a”1”in the beginning of the number which indicates that it was manufactured in the US.  Therefore you
don't
pay the 2.5% duty when importing the US.
Since the vehicle is older than 25 years, there are
no EPA or DOT issues
.  I called the EPA (734 214 4100) and the DOT (202 366 5291) to verify.
1983 Jeep CJ7 Laredo.   Unrestored 4.2 liter, inline 6 cylinder engine with 5 speed manual transmission, power steering, power brakes and
Hard & Soft Top, Hard Doors.

I am the second owner of this piece of history.  The original owner used it for 3 months of each year.  There is no rust rot on the vehicle.  The original owner even siliconed the floor bolts to prevent moisture from creeping up into the carpet. The carpet and interior are in excellent shape.
As soon as it was in my possesion (March 2017) I had a professional thoroughly coat it with Corrosion Free Formula 3000.
See picture of the Jeep during the process.
I then had it re-coated again before I stored it for the winter (
2nd coat wasn't necessary however I want to preserve this piece of history the best way I know how

Like most CJ7's, the clock, centre lockable console and radio are not original.  The only other items that are not original are the leaf springs and shocks (your welcome).  For a better ride, the Jeep has greasable shackles that fit Jeep YJ leaf springs.  Before I had it shipped to me I had the local 4Wheel Parts store install a new 2.5”lift with Rubicon shocks and YJ leaf springs.  When it arrived I felt it was too high so I had new lower Bilstein shocks and new stock height YJ leaf springs installed.  The spare Rubicon shocks and leaf springs are included in the price. There are no miles on these shocks and leaf springs.  New brake lines installed when the Bilstein's were put on.
You can drive this Jeep with one finger on the wheel.  It drives straight.
The overall paint is great for the 35 year old gem.

I also came across a set of original CJ7 Wagon Wheels complete with centre caps and three spare caps (total seven centre caps).  These rims are currently on old tires.  These rims and centre caps are included in the price.
Four(4) 31”BF Goodrich All-Terrain T/A's with less than 4500 kms (2800 miles). The spare has zero km/miles.
Factory Hardtop with the Interior light still working.  The interior colour of the top is white and the exterior is black.
New BestTop SunRider soft top last summer.
Car Cover included.

I don't need help selling this on consignment. I'm not in a hurry to sell.  Serious enquiries only.  Please have your wife's blessing before you contact me. Reason for selling, my wife wants something more sporty like an old Porsche to cruise in on the weekends.
Thanks,
Todd

Looking and running great, this 1981 Jeep CJ7 Renegade is an exhilarating vintage ride that's configured for scaling any off-road obstacles you steer it towards, yet it's also plenty well-suited for more civilized conditions.

While Jeep has deep roots in military usage, the CJ7 reflects the recognition that civilians were becoming enthralled with having a motorized mountain goat at their disposal. It's markedly longer and a bit wider than its predecessor and affords a much smoother ride, and you'll find actual doors sitting where cutouts had been. Clad in very fresh Dune paint, with crisp Renegade lettering on its hood, this CJ7 has an undeniably capable look. It's well fitted from all angles, and you'll find its mega sturdy front and rear bumpers sitting nice and level both in front and back. With a 10,500 lb. capacity jack securely mounted on its hood and a sturdy new winch sitting up front, it not only looks like it could get itself out of any jam, but could ably come to the rescue if you came across any unfortunate motorist that got themselves in too deep. Should the weather turn while you're out blazing a path, a new soft top sits in place for protection.

The interior sports a largely refurbished look - it's just a short yardage away from being in top form, and a few minor fixes will put it over the goal line. Step inside and you'll find freshly painted surfaces surrounding you, with an especially clean dash up front that features upgraded digital gauges in its cluster and a fresh pad on top. A pair of high backed buckets sits firmly in place with a bench behind. The air conditioning system is all present and accounted for but needs servicing to be in top form and while it has a new Painless Wiring harness, things like the radio, wipers, horn and LED spotlights do still need to be hooked up to be functional. So, while it's ''almost there'', it's still very enjoyable as it is. And it's worth mentioning that the entire floor area has been well-treated with spray on liner to protect it from wear and the elements.

All the components needed for a great time both on and off the road are on board. There's a 258-cubic inch inline 6 under the hood with a 2-barrel Weber on top, and the engine bay it sits in has been well looked after, judging from its grime-free appearance and collection of fresh hoses. The engine pairs up with a 5-speed manual transmission with the versatile gearing to handle any driving conditions you encounter. The CJ7 has substantial ground clearance that combines with a firm ride reinforced by its Skyjacker shocks, so you have one very surefooted vehicle at your command when you engage its four-wheel drive - it's no mere coincidence that this model is still a favorite among competitive mud racers and rock climbers alike. An aluminum radiator sits up front, accompanied by an electric fan to keep temperatures in check during your offroad adventures. With its featured power steering and 4-wheel power brakes, this vintage Jeep has the manners you'd want in a frequent driver, as it patrols roads both paved and unpaved on its set of 15'' American Racing wheels outfitted with sturdy Kenda Klever M/T tires.
Looking for a vintage off-roader that's equipped to handle whatever you send its way? Check out this 1981 Jeep CJ7 Renegade. Call today!

The Gateway classic Cars showroom on Indianapolis is pleased to present this mudslinging mountain climbing 1983 Jeep CJ7. This beauty has 154840 miles on her with 100000 of the miles being flat tow miles. This jeep comes with a 4.2L inline 6 and a Chrysler 900 Torque Flight transmission with both being rebuilt less than 30000 miles ago in 2007. Also in 2007 the current owner had the Jeep repainted and the right rear quarter panel replaced (all other panels are original). This car has been family owned since it was driven off the lot. The current owner has taken great care of the vehicle and has made some quality upgraded to her. She has had a complete drive train rebuild. Brakes replaced with disk brakes in the front and a corvette power breaks master cylinder. She has a d-300 transfer case that is clocked to level with the J.D. stainless steel twin stick control. She has a sight tube on the transfer case for lube level indication. She"??s got 33/12.5 Dayton tires with Mickey Thompson 15x10 aluminum wheels. This Jeep fires right up with her electronic ignition and electronic choke. She is set up for flat tow with no restrictions. You will be pleased to find that the headlights brake lights parking lights reverse lights curtesy lights and turn signals are all operational. The wipers gauges and horn are all responsive and work like a charm with the speedometer reading 7 MPH slower then the actual speed due to the larger tires. For more information on this 1983 Jeep please call the Indianapolis showroom at (317) 688-1100 or email us at

V8 power and a great red and black combination make this 1978 Jeep CJ7 such a hot ticket.

This Jeep is distinctive from the first moment you lay eyes on it.  The red paint instantly turns attention to this classic icon.  The black Renegade lettering is the perfect match for the other dark elements this 4x4 has to offer like on the bumpers, fender flares, removable doors, and folding soft top.  It's a total impression that looks just as good driving down High Street as it does exploring the inner forest.

Inside you get an all-black interior that looks quite good.  There has been recent investment in new seat covers, which always sets a nice tone for the whole interior.  With the roll bar painted red, this has the perfect color-coordination when the top is down (the way Jeeps are meant to be.) In fact, while all jeeps were made for the rugged outdoors, this one goes further with the entire floor and steel sides covered in tough liner paint.  But even going out in nature doesn't mean you have to have it rough, and that's because the AM/FM stereo has connections for Bluetooth and iPods.

Jeep people will love looking over your engine bay because it looks so tidy and correct.  In fact, it's even suspected that this is the original 304 cubic-inch V8.  This AMC motor is that perfect power plant that combines V8 muscle with Jeep-level robustness.  On the road, this total package feels good with the three-speed automatic transmission and the newer radial tires on those bright Eagle Alloys wheels.  But what you really want this classic Jeep for is a little off-road fun.  So on the trail, the extra wallop of V8 power is a great partner with the sturdy 4x4 components like the two-speed transfer case.
Bold packaging, the right features, and V8 power – this is the CJ7 is the right way to enjoy an icon. Call now!

This Jeep was one of a very limited edition built to commemorate the ''Jeepers Jamboree''. Each Jambo was numbered by a special commemorative plaque, or badge, on the dash denoting its production number. This is the only AMC Jeep to have ever been specially numbered. In addition, the Jambos carry a special trim code of 1EN on their firewall VIN tag.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this rare and unique 1982 Jeep CJ7 Jamboree. Apparently, less than 650 were produced and this is number 273 produced. The Jeep is in wonderful condition inside and out courtesy of a thorough restoration by its previous owner. It is fitted with a ton of desirable options such as a 5-Speed Transmission, Power Steering, Clock, Tachometer, and more. The previous owner claims that the Engine, Radiator, Transmission, Clutch Assembly, Entire Wiring Harness, Complete interior, Replaced Body-to-Frame Mounts with neoprene, New Disc and Drum Brakes, Four Wheel Drive system, New Bikini Top, and a Complete repaint with new Clear Coat. In addition, a High-Tech AM/FM/CD Audio System with iPod was added as well. The body is in great condition and features chrome wheels with 31 in tires on 15in wheels, rear mounted spare, bull bar with spotlights, and side steps.

Fitted with 4.2L I6, this Jeep runs and drives very well and would make the perfect summer companion. If you're looking for a super cool collectible Jeep CJ, the Jambo is it. It is without a doubt the rarest CJ-7 ever built. It is suggested that less than 250 of these still exist. Now is the time to pick up a rare collectable Jeep!
